intro: Monnina reticulata, commonly known as redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, showy pink to purple flowers. The plant has a fibrous root system and hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Monnina reticulata is part of the family Onagraceae and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dry fields.
